greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1; for m >= 2, a(m) = sum{p|m} a(pi(p)), where the sum is over the distinct prime divisors p of m and pi(p) is the order of p among the primes = the number of primes <= p.
mathematica: PrimeFactors[n_Integer] := Flatten[ Table[ # [[1]], {1}] & /@ FactorInteger[n]]; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = (Plus @@ (a[ # ] & /@ PrimePi[ PrimeFactors[n]])); Table[ a[n], {n, 105}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 04 2004 *)
xref: Cf. A093321, A066328, A094162 (for where n first appears).
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Apr 26 2004
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 04 2004
